etymology.description: 尭(尭) (yáo, "high") as phonetic + 尸(尸) (shī, "corpse") as semantic = slang term originally referring to male genitalia -> later extended to mean 'cocky' or 'arrogant'
etymology.interpretation: The character 屌(diao) cleverly combines elements to convey its vulgar meaning, using 尸(尸) to set a bodily context and 尭(尭) to suggest a crude and boastful tone.

examples.chinese: 医生检查他的屌(醫生檢查他的屌)，发现有异常(發現有異常)。
examples.pinyin: Yīshēng jiǎnchá tā de diǎo, fāxiàn yǒu yìcháng.
examples.english: The doctor examined his genitalia and found something abnormal.
